Comments_List: The course teaches you to think about historical continuities and institutional legacies in the study of political science. While the course is on Turkey, it is easy to draw parallels to many other countries and governments and historical periods. The strength of this course lies in its strong applicability.

The class material is very interesting and the professor very intellectual and reliable. As with any seminar, it depends on the cohort of students as well - but the discussion level was generally consistent throughout the semester and I enjoyed it very much.
Seemed like the readings were not directly related to the discussion

I definitely recommend it to anyone who is looking for something different and challenging - Turkey is a unique area with very distinct cultural, economic, political influences. And if you were to study it with anyone, you should study with this professor.
Take it if you are interested in Turkey
